channel.title: Get Started on Jenkins X
channel.description: Recent content in Get Started on Jenkins X

item.title: Install jx
item.description: Pick the most suitable instructions for your operating system: macOs On a Mac you can use brew: brew tap jenkins-x/jx brew install jx Or if you have not installed brew and prefer to install by hand: curl -L https://github.com/jenkins-x/jx/releases/download/v1.1.4/jx-darwin-amd64.tar.gz | tar xzv sudo mv jx /usr/local/bin Linux curl -L https://github.com/jenkins-x/jx/releases/download/v1.1.4/jx-linux-amd64.tar.gz | tar xzv sudo mv jx /usr/local/bin Other platforms download the binary for jx and add it to your $PATH

item.title: Create new Cluster
item.description: To create a new Kubernetes cluster with Jenkins X installed use the jx create cluster command: jx create cluster A number of different public cloud providers are supported such as Using Google Cloud (GKE) Use the jx create cluster gke command: jx create cluster gke Using Amazon (AWS) Use the jx create cluster aws command: jx create cluster aws This will use kops on your Amazon account to create a new kubernetes cluster and install Jenkins X

item.title: Install on Kubernetes
item.description: To install Jenkins X on an existing kubernetes cluster use the jx install command: jx install
